sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of natural disaster occurring in a region
message_1: What is the probability of a hurricane hitting a specific coastal town in Florida in any given year, given that historically hurricanes have hit that town an average of 2 times in every 20 years?
message_2:
To find the probability of a hurricane hitting the specific coastal town in Florida in any given year, we can use the historical data provided.

Historically, hurricanes have hit the town 2 times in 20 years. So, the probability of a hurricane hitting the town in any given year can be calculated as follows:

Probability = (Number of times a hurricane hit the town) / (Total number of years)

Probability = 2 / 20

Probability = 1 / 10

Therefore, the probability of a hurricane hitting the specific coastal town in Florida in any given year is 1/10 or 0.1, which is equivalent to 10%.
